words.definition: An aquarium is a building where fish and underwater animals are kept.
words.example: We saw a scary shark at the aquarium.

words.definition: If something is arbitrary, it is not based on any plan or system.
words.example: The rules seemed arbitrary and made no sense.

words.definition: An autobiography is a story of a person's life written by that person.
words.example: I read an autobiography about my favorite musician.

words.definition: A convention is behavior that is considered to be common or polite.
words.example: It is a convention to shake hands when you meet someone.

words.definition: If someone is gracious, they are kind and polite.
words.example: She was a gracious host and made us feel welcome.

words.definition: To improve something means to make it better.
words.example: I want to improve my English speaking skills.

words.definition: To insulate something means to protect it from heat, cold, or noise.
words.example: The house was well-insulated to keep it warm in the winter.

words.definition: To intrigue someone means to make them very interested.
words.example: The mystery story intrigued me from the beginning.

words.definition: Longevity is a long life.
words.example: Healthy eating and exercise can increase your longevity.

words.definition: To misplace something means to lose it for a short time.
words.example: I misplaced my keys and couldn't find them anywhere.

words.definition: When a child is naughty, they behave badly.
words.example: The naughty boy broke the window with a ball.

words.definition: A norm is a standard or way of behaving that is typical.
words.example: It is the norm to wear a suit to a job interview.

words.definition: An orangutan is a large ape with long orange hair.
words.example: We saw an orangutan climbing a tree at the zoo.

words.definition: To overload something means to put too much on it.
words.example: Don't overload the washing machine with too many clothes.

words.definition: Philanthropy is the practice of giving money to help people.
words.example: The billionaire was known for his philanthropy.

words.definition: To probe something means to explore or examine it closely.
words.example: The scientist used a tool to probe the soil.

words.definition: A recipient is a person who receives something.
words.example: She was the recipient of a prestigious award.

words.definition: A reptile is a cold-blooded animal such as a snake or lizard.
words.example: Lizards and crocodiles are examples of reptiles.

words.definition: To thrive means to grow or develop very well.
words.example: The plants thrived in the sunny garden.

words.definition: If something is ultimate, it is final or most important.
words.example: The ultimate goal of the game is to win.
